Title: Potential Data Repudiation by Service App
Description: Service App claims that it did not receive data from a source outside the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.

Title: Potential Process Crash or Stop for Service App
Description: Service App crashes, halts, stops or runs slowly; in all cases violating an availability metric.

Title: Data Flow HTTPS Is Potentially Interrupted
Description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.

Title: Elevation Using Impersonation
Description: Service App may be able to impersonate the context of Customer in order to gain additional privilege.

Title: Service App May be Subject to Elevation of Privilege Using Remote Code Execution
Description: Customer may be able to remotely execute code for Service App.

Title: Elevation by Changing the Execution Flow in Service App
Description: An attacker may pass data into Service App in order to change the flow of program execution within Service App to the attacker's choosing.

Title: Spoofing of the Customer External Destination Entity
Description: Customer may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being sent to the attacker's target instead of Customer. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the external entity.

Title: External Entity Customer Potentially Denies Receiving Data
Description: Customer claims that it did not receive data from a process on the other side of the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.

Title: Data Flow HTTPS Is Potentially Interrupted
Description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.

Title: Spoofing of Destination Data Store Cloud Storage
Description: Cloud Storage may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being written to the attacker's target instead of Cloud Storage. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the destination data store.

Title: Authorization Bypass
Description: Can you access Cloud Storage and bypass the permissions for the object? For example by editing the files directly with a hex editor, or reaching it via filesharing? Ensure that your program is the only one that can access the data, and that all other subjects have to use your interface.

Title: Potential Excessive Resource Consumption for Service App or Cloud Storage
Description: Does Service App or Cloud Storage take explicit steps to control resource consumption? Resource consumption attacks can be hard to deal with, and there are times that it makes sense to let the OS do the job. Be careful that your resource requests don't deadlock, and that they do timeout.

Title: Spoofing of Destination Data Store Cloud Storage
Description: Cloud Storage may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being written to the attacker's target instead of Cloud Storage. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the destination data store.

Title: Authorization Bypass
Description: Can you access Cloud Storage and bypass the permissions for the object? For example by editing the files directly with a hex editor, or reaching it via filesharing? Ensure that your program is the only one that can access the data, and that all other subjects have to use your interface.

Title: Potential Excessive Resource Consumption for Service App or Cloud Storage
Description: Does Service App or Cloud Storage take explicit steps to control resource consumption? Resource consumption attacks can be hard to deal with, and there are times that it makes sense to let the OS do the job. Be careful that your resource requests don't deadlock, and that they do timeout.

Title: Elevation Using Impersonation
Description: Service App may be able to impersonate the context of Authorization Provider in order to gain additional privilege.

Title: SSH Version 1
Description: SSH version 1 is fundamentally vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks. Use version 2 instead.
